Others have complained about this problem:
http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4030718.html
http://forum.java.sun.com/read/16789542/qA45JPrcnDCUAAi5T#LR

Then I found this little nugget:
http://www.blockout.net/javabug4030718/

That seems to work-around the problem.

regards

--- In junit@y..., afuqua_egroups@y... wrote:
> Does anyone know how to get rid of the "AWT-Windows" thread? 
> Interrupting it doesn't work and I don't want to System.exit() for 
> a number of reasons.
> 
> My team runs junit (junit.textui.testrunner) from JBuilder and also 
> from Ant. This thread is hanging out and preventing the tests from 
> finishing completely.
> 
> We used to avoid doing anything GUI related in the tests (because
of 
> this thread), but now we want to do more and this problem is 
cramping 
> our style.
> 
> THANKS
subject: Re: HDI kill the "AWT-Windows" thread?
